featuredArticle.title: How Do Missionaries Embody the Message?

recentArticles.title: Divine Appointments and Eternal Joy
recentArticles.description: Can God redirect your day for someone’s eternity? In this episode of Light + Truth, John Piper opens Acts 8:26–40 to show how Spirit-led detours can yield everlasting joy.

recentArticles.title: The High Price of Watching Nudity
recentArticles.description: In a day when sexualized content seems to be everywhere, including in many shows and movies, Pastor John gives twelve reasons to never watch nudity.

recentArticles.title: When Wonders Overshadow Christ
recentArticles.description: What’s missing from counterfeit faith? In this episode of Light + Truth, John Piper opens Acts 8:9–24 to expose a belief amazed by wonders yet blind to sin and the worth of Christ.

recentArticles.title: Disciple-Making in a Busy Season
recentArticles.description: Disciple-making seemed more manageable before marriage, kids, and a full-time job. How can we still obey Jesus’s call in a life with little room?

recentArticles.title: Why False Teaching Is Like Gangrene
recentArticles.subtitle: 2 Timothy 2:16–19, Part 1
recentArticles.description: Irreverent babble leads only to more ungodliness. John Piper warns against teaching that is as poisonous as it is empty.

recentArticles.title: We Can’t Endure on Our Own
recentArticles.description: What might Simon of Cyrene teach us about supporting one another in trials? Pastor John digs into the perseverance of the saints and the church’s crucial role.

recentArticles.title: The Servant Called Death
recentArticles.description: What does Satan want death to do to you? In this episode of Light + Truth, John Piper opens Acts 7:54–8:1 to show how God makes death serve his people, not destroy them.

recentArticles.title: Finally Done with Porn
recentArticles.description: Temptations to view pornography may be new, but fighting lust is not. What wisdom can an old saint offer us as we wage war against sexual sin?

recentArticles.title: God’s Mission Triumphs Through Prayerful Suffering
recentArticles.description: As Jesus bleeds in Gethsemane and then submits to arrest, we see that the mission of God triumphs through prayerful suffering, not the self-defending sword.

recentArticles.title: How Do You Rightly Handle the Word of Truth?
recentArticles.subtitle: 2 Timothy 2:14–15, Part 2
recentArticles.description: How do we teach the word of God in a manner approved by God? John Piper emphasizes the importance of faith and grace in the work of ministry.
